title: ATBS LTD Trains Technicians, Customers On Gate Automation
text:
Technology | 8 September 2015 10:49 CET ATBS LTD Trains Technicians, Customers On Gate Automation Source: Abubakari Seidu Ajarfor, [email protected] 
The Advance Technology Barbs Security [ATBS] Service Limited has organised a 5day training workshop for technicians and customers to deepen their technical skills and knowledge on security installation systems. 
Mr. Eric Owusu, the Chief Executive Officer [CEO], Advance Technology Barbs Security [ATBS] Service, said the training was purposely to train technicians and customers for gate automation. 
He explained that the global development of technology has brought up new and sophisticated equipments which call for the need to train and development technicians to become professionally and skillful in installations and maintenances. 
“We have a technical team who are experts. When you call us within a day you should be able to get your problem solved,” he stated. 
Mr. Owusu added that end users are not also left out as they were schooled on how to change the motor to manual incase of power failure but has assured of a 24hour power backup. 
He said his outfit offers professional services on installation of automatic gates including services such as electric fencing, CCTV installation, access control, video intercoms and many more. 
The unique of the product, according to him, it’s a product from South Africa which has been tried and tested in Ghana over a decade. 
He noted that over 1000 pieces of the motors have been supplied to houses and companies which can be integrated to the electric fence. 
According to him, the prices are unbeatable with different sizes of motors depending on the size of the gate. 
The challenge, he said, is the influx of fake and inferior products from countries which often creates a bad impression for the entire dealers. 
He advices customers to conduct a background check about a particular company before they seek for their services and the supplying of security systems since they can be operating as spies on them. IMG-20150907-WA0006
